cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 25 miles WNW of Nassau and 180 miles SE of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest through the north-western Bahamas today, then paralleling and scraping the Florida east coast tonight and Friday, afterward lifting toward coastal GA/SC
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: very near the east-central Florida coast (around Cape Canaveral area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Edisto Beach SC to South Santee River SC (Hurricane Watch), various FL west-coast reaches under TS watch
weather_observation.warning_coast: North of Golden Beach FL to Edisto Beach SC, including Canaveral Port District and Lake Okeechobee (Hurricane Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida east coast, Georgia and South Carolina coasts
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane-force winds possible; tropical-storm-force winds (>39 mph) almost certain and 50-kt winds (58 mph) very likely (~80 %)
weather_observation.storm_surge: Life-threatening surge 6–9 ft above ground possible if peak surge coincides with high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches with isolated amounts up to 12 inches along the Space Coast including Port Canaveral
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large destructive waves, dangerous surf and rip currents; operational disruption from prolonged gale/hurricane winds and inundation
